item.title: Red Dead Redemption: 8 Best Reasons To Go For A High Honor Run
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Maintaining high honor in Red Dead Redemption earns John Marston more money through unlocks and better pricing.
  • High honor leads to friendly NPC interactions, reducing hostilities and showcasing character development.
  • High honor offers gameplay advantages like exclusive items, reduced adversary accuracy, and fewer bounty hunters.

In Red Dead Redemption , John Marston is an ex-outlaw seeking redemption as he is forced by the government to capture members of his former gang. His actions throughout the game shape his honor level, affecting how others treat him and his own legacy. This system offers players a morally complex experience.

Choosing to maintain high honor in Red Dead Redemption allows John to redeem himself in the eyes of others and himself, reflecting his desire to leave behind a dark past. There are various reasons for high honor in Red Dead Redemption , ranging from gameplay advantages to narrative benefits, enhancing immersion in the character's story.

Warning: This content contains major spoilers â€” specifically regarding the endings of Red Dead Redemption and Red Dead Redemption 2 .

8 Easier To Make Money

Being Honorable Brings Monetary Benefits To Players

Players desiring to make a fortune for John Marston during his journey through the Wild West in Red Dead Redemption 1 should consider maintaining high honor for the character. This is because certain perks are unlocked, increasing the money the protagonist receives when performing various actions across the map.

From selling items to merchants, such as pelts, to the rewards from side jobs, especially bounty hunting, the player is awarded more dollars upon completion when possessing a high honor value. Thus, players have more purchasing power to acquire other items when restocking equipment.

7 Friendly Interactions With NPCs

People Like John Marston More With High Honor

Although it doesn't bring significant influences to the mechanics of Red Dead Redemption , having high honor in the game is a fundamental factor that greatly enhances possible roleplays of the Old West. With a high honor value, players will have friendlier interactions with many NPCs found along the roads or in towns.

This receptiveness eases John's daily life in the Old West by reducing hostile situations and unwanted conflicts with inhabitants. Additionally, it demonstrates the character's evolution in search of a better future, creating a journey more coherent with what is established about him.

6 Exclusive Items For High Honor

John Marston Can Obtain New Equipment

Besides better prices in stores across the game's map, having high honor in the first Red Dead Redemption also means that John Marston can access some exclusive items, one of the main ones being the Duster Coat. It is a new outfit option that players can use to customize the character's appearance, linked to the game's "Peacemaker" honor level.

Although it doesn't offer any perks that grant new abilities or benefits to the character, it's a stylish garment that adds a certain flair to the cowboy. Moreover, for players who want to complete all the achievements that Red Dead Redemption 1 has to offer, possessing this item is one of the requirements, so players should keep an eye on John Marston's honor.

5 Enemies Have Less Chance To Hit John Marston

High Honor Reduces Adversaries' Accuracy

For players struggling with the frenetic shootouts of Red Dead Redemption , it's possible to make things a bit easier with high honor in the game. This is because, at the third and final level of this mechanic, a random event can be witnessed. A nun will appear and gift John with the Obscuridad del Santo Andres, one of the best items in the game.

Resembling a rosary, this item reduces the chance of the game's protagonist being hit by enemies by 25%, increasing his chances of coming out of combat unscathed. However, it's worth mentioning that this equipment, although powerful, is linked to the character's honor, so if it decreases throughout the story, it will no longer be possible to access its benefits.

4 It's Befitting Of Red Dead Redemption's Story

According To The Lore, John Is Inclined Toward High Honor

Unlike Red Dead Redemption 2 , where Arthur Morgan's honor can completely change the context of the game's ending, these values do not influence John Marston's fate. However, given the narrative that follows, the honorable path is what best suits the character overall.

From the beginning, for example, it is established that he is someone seeking to leave behind a life of crime and become a better man, providing more support for his own family. Therefore, maintaining high honor is a reflection of the first game's protagonist's struggle, trying to redeem many crimes he committed in the past.

3 Fewer Bounty Hunters

A More Peaceful Experience When Exploring The Map

Although the game's shootouts are well-crafted, sometimes players just want to explore the map and hunt animals peacefully, but all this tranquility can be disrupted by bounty hunters. Therefore, one of the benefits of having high honor in Red Dead Redemption is that the chance of them appearing is lower.

Thus, players have more freedom to explore all the content the game has to offer in peace, as they won't need to constantly stop what they're doing just to deal with bounty hunters after John Marston's head. These encounters, incidentally, become more frequent and dangerous when the character has low honor.

2 Preserving Arthur Morgan's Wishes

The Protagonist Of Red Dead Redemption 2 Is Important

Although not mentioned in the events of the first Red Dead Redemption , Arthur Morgan is one of the most important characters in the franchise and has a very close relationship with John Marston. Many events in his story aim to offer John opportunities to become a better man.

Maintaining high honor in Red Dead Redemption is fundamental for players who wish to honor Arthur Morgan's legacy, valuing his efforts and sacrifices to ensure that John Marston evolves. In this way, players can also perform a roleplay more faithful to the narrative, reinforcing the friendship between the two characters and respecting the story's development.

1 A Consistent Story Ending

And Also Very Sad

For those already familiar with the narrative of Red Dead Redemption , it's known that regardless of the path taken by John Marston in the story, the character's ending will be one of the most tragic in Rockstar's games. Even though the character fights against the choices he made in the past, he ends up being betrayed and killed in a cowardly manner.

However, the emotional weight of these events in the game makes more sense when his honor is high, as it represents someone who, at the end of the story, was a better person and at peace with himself. If players opt for a path of crimes, the betrayal the protagonist experiences in the final moments is consistent with the life he led, not being as complex.

item.title: PS Plus: A Comprehensive List Of Every Monthly Game It's Added
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Free Games PS Plus Essential: November 2024
  • All Monthly Games That Were Free On PS Plus Essential
  • All Games That Were Added To PS Plus Extra
    • October 2024 PS Plus Extra
  • All Classic Games That Were Added To PS Plus Premium
    • October 2024 PS Plus Premium

Sony launched the new era of PlayStation Plus in June 2022, combining the previous version with PS Now. Although the latter subscription service was around for a long time, PS Now struggled to get over its early negative reputation, so a revamp was needed to wipe the slate clean.

PS Plus is split into three tiers: Essential , Extra , and Premium . Essential unlocks PlayStation's online features along with providing a couple of free monthly games. Along with Essential's offerings, Extra grants access to hundreds of PS5 and PS4 games; meanwhile, Premium extends the lineup to include older consoles. Each month, Sony adds a bunch of new PS Plus games to each tier, including first-party exclusives, third-party juggernauts, and indie darlings. Some months are better than others, but they all tend to include a couple of standouts. What are all the monthly games that have been added to PS Plus?

Updated October 31, 2024 by Mark Sammut: The PS Plus Essential games for November 2024 have been announced.

Free Games PS Plus Essential: November 2024

Hot Wheels Unleashed 2: Turbocharged (PS5/PS4), Ghostwire: Tokyo (PS5), & Death Note Killer Within (PS5/PS4)

The November 2024 PS Plus Essential lineup will likely not go down as an all-time great, but its games are still exciting in their own right. While most months have a marquee title that sits above the other two, November is a bit of an outlier as all three games are roughly of the same level, all the while catering to wildly different demographics and audiences. Even if it might not have that "huge" title, the lineup is arguably well-rounded, offering a single-player adventure, a racer with both solo and multiplayer, and a new PvP Day One project.

Ghostwire: Tokyo drops players in Japan's capital, albeit a version stripped of people and home to youkai. While not exactly horror, the game takes some ideas from the genre and offers an atmospheric setting that balances open-world-style areas with occasional linear sections. The first-person combat is not extremely deep, but it is stylish and quite fun. Ghostwire: Tokyo has been relatively accessible over the last year, including a stint as part of PS Plus Extra, so it is not that exciting of a pick.

Roughly a year following its debut, H ot Wheels Unleashed 2: Turbocharged is sprinting its way to PS Plus, hopefully satisfying racing fans with a preference for arcade goodness. Licensed games used to have a well-earned negative reputation, but that does not reflect the state of most modern releases. Hot Wheels Unleashed 2 is a very competent racer with top-notch visuals, solid controls, and a huge selection of vehicles. It should be fun for both adults and kids.

Finally, there is Death Note Killer Within , a Day One PS Plus Essential arrival that is also a console exclusive. Beloved as the manga and anime are, a new Death Note game was probably not on a lot of people's radars, and it will be interesting to see if Bandai Namco's project finds an audience. Considering this is a social deduction game that challenges up to 10 players to find who has the Death Note, Killer Within needs to foster a community pretty quickly or risk fading into obscurity.

All Monthly Games That Were Free On PS Plus Essential

  • 1- Month Price: $9.99
  • 3-Month Price : $24.99
  • 12-Month Price: $79.99

Formerly known as just PS Plus, Essential is the minimum required to play online multiplayer on the PS5 or PS4. Every month, the tier rotates a couple of new free PS Plus games . While these titles are only available to purchase for roughly a month, anyone who picks them up can continue to play them after that point as long as they have an active subscription.

All Games That Were Added To PS Plus Extra

October 2024 PS Plus Extra (Starting From October 15)

  • 1-Month Price: $14.99
  • 3-Month Price : $39.99
  • 12-Month Price: $134.99

PS Plus Extra is the first tier that includes a catalog featuring hundreds of games. Extra focuses exclusively on PS5 and PS4 titles, with each month expanding the existing library with roughly 10 to 20 new additions. Unlike Essential, PS Plus Extra's games are available indefinitely, although some could be removed after spending a few months on the service.

With Halloween right around the corner, the October 2024 PS Plus lineup leans into horror and horror-adjacent content, although not exclusively. The month's biggest arrival is Dead Island 2 , an over-the-top zombie slasher that allows players to rampage through a post-apocalyptic Los Angeles. While not exactly offering narrative depth, the game is just fun, particularly its satisfying dismemberment and gore system. Dead Island 2 is also a solid co-op option for any friends, relatives, or partners who want to eradicate the undead together.

The rest of October's selection is by no means bad either, and there are a couple of great titles. Gris is a highly respected indie release with strong visuals and storytelling. Return to Monkey Island harbors back to the good old days of point-and-click adventures, reviving arguably the genre's most beloved property. Ghostbusters: Spirits Unleashed and The Dark Pictures Anthology: The Devil in Me fit the month's Halloween theme, and the latter is a fairly enjoyable entry in Supermassive's series. Racing fans can also check out Overpass 2 and Tour de France 2023 â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹.

All Classic Games That Were Added To PS Plus Premium

October 2024 PS Plus Premium (Starting From October 15)

  • 1-Month Price: $17.99/month
  • 3-Month Price : $49.99
  • 12-Month Price: $159.99

PS Plus Premium includes everything available on Sony's service. Along with Essential and Extra's games and benefits, this tier includes a classic catalog of PS3, PS2, PS1, and PSP games, along with some PS4 remasters. Premium's monthly additions have been inconsistent so far, and it is not unusual for a month to go by with barely any classic additions to the tier.

Although most lineups contain only a handful of classics, PS Plus Premium has been steadily enhancing its old-school library, particularly when it comes to PSP and PS1 releases. The games might not all be bona fide masterpieces, but the selection covers both well-known and obscure properties. Starting from June 2024, Sony has begun to add PS VR2 games to PS Plus Premium.

October 2024's PS Plus Premium lineup has two pretty big classics, at least for the horror genre. Dino Crisis took the Resident Evil formula and added dinosaurs, a strategy that paid off fairly well. Capcom's franchise has been dormant for a long time by this point, and a revival does not appear to be on the cards currently. Still, the original PS1 game is a nostalgic delight that is still fun to play, even if its age is obvious. Joining its remake, Siren: Blood Curse , on PS Plus Premium, the PS2's Siren is a creepy cult horror game that focuses on exploration and stealth over action.

The month's other two titles move away from horror, with R-Type Dimensions EX offering something for side-scrolling shooter fans. Meanwhile, The Last Clockwinder is October's PS VR2 addition.

PS VR 2

item.title: Tetris Forever Preview: A Love Letter to Gaming History
item.description:
While it may not have a world-famous mascot like Super Mario or an array of adorable merchandise-ready monsters like Pokemon , Tetris has remained one of the best-selling franchises in all of gaming, and it's about to hit its 40th anniversary. To celebrate the momentous occasion, developer Digital Eclipse is releasing Tetris Forever , the third entry in its Gold Master Series. Like The Making of Karateka and Llamasoft: The Jeff Minter Story before it, Tetris Forever is a kind of interactive museum, letting fans learn about the long, storied history of Tetris through archival footage and gameplay.

Game Rant recently had the chance to attend a private hands-off demo of Tetris Forever . We were given a general overview of the game's structure, saw a few classic Tetris titles in action, and got an extensive look at Digital Eclipse's original Tetris Time Warp game, which is included in the collection.

Tetris Forever Pays Homage at Every Turn

Just like the Gold Master Series titles before it, Tetris Forever splits its interactive museum into separate chapters or timelines. There will be five timelines to explore, each focused on a different key period of Tetris ' history, such as its creation or its relationship with Nintendo. These timelines contain text passages, archival footage, and documentary footage, all designed to give fans some insight into Tetris ' evolution over the years.

After learning the key context behind each of Tetris Forever 's games, players can hop into gameplay directly from the timeline. During Game Rant's preview, Digital Eclipse kicked things off by showing off the very first Tetris iteration, created by Alexey Pajitnov in June 1984 for the Electronika 60. Digital Eclipse explained that no real copies of this original iteration really exist anymore, so the studio has tried its best to remake the game as accurately as it can.

Era-accurate sounds, gameplay mechanics, and visuals were all on display during this demo, capturing the look and feel of the 40-year-old Tetris iteration very well. This Tetris Forever version of the original game even comes with a few different visual overlays to imitate the look of the 1985 iteration. When playing the game, the border of the screen also changes to look like the console/PC the game was originally released on, which feels like the cherry on top of Tetris Forever 's cake of authenticity.

There are 15 games currently confirmed to appear in Tetris Forever . These range from the Apple II version of the original Tetris and Tetris 2 on the Famicom to Tetris Battle Gaiden on the Super Famicom and Super Bombliss DX on the Game Boy Color. Along with well-known iterations of the beloved puzzle game, Tetris Forever is home to some rarer entries, some of which have never left Japan before.

Tetris Forever obviously can't include every iteration of Tetris from the past 40 years. Digital Eclipse mentioned during the preview that some omissions were due to licensing/rights issues.

Tetris Time Warp Embraces and Celebrates Nostalgia

In each of Digital Eclipse's Gold Master Series titles, the developer has included at least one original game in the collection. In Tetris Forever , this original game is Tetris Time Warp , which Game Rant's preview primarily focused on. While Tetris Time Warp begins like any other traditional version of the block-falling puzzle game, things take a thrilling turn on level 10.

After clearing 10 lines in Tetris Time Warp , players will be presented with a titular Time Warp Tetromino. This Time Warp block cycles through four different visual styles, each one based on a different period of Tetris history. Once this block is placed, the player's screen is transported back in time to the era that the Time Warp block represented. For instance, placing a Time Warp block from the 1984 version of the game will send players back to 1984, changing the sound design, appearance, and gameplay mechanics to match the era.

When transported back in time, players are given a unique challenge for the era. These challenges have a 15-second time limit and range from simply clearing four lines to detonating a big bomb ( Bombliss ). Completing these objectives within the time limit will reward the player with points and progress them onto the next era on the timeline, where they're given another opportunity to complete a challenge. This continues until the player hits the modern era again, or loses their time-sensitive challenge.

Tetris Time Warp will have 3 distinct eras, but 4 Time Warp Tetrominos. The fourth Time Warp block is golden and represents the modern age of Tetris . This block doesn't transport the player back in time but instead causes a landslide, clearing a good portion of the screen for any players in desperate need of assistance.

Everything Included in Tetris Time Warp

Tetris Time Warp will ship with four unique game modes. Time Warp Score is the standard Tetris Time Warp mode , seeing players aim to achieve the highest score possible. The game will also have 3-Min Time Attack , Modern Marathon , and 1989 Marathon , with the latter being a love letter to the Game Boy version of Tetris , complete with its own extended version of the iconic original musical theme.

Players will also be able to show off their Tetris Time Warp skills to their friends, with the game supporting 4-player splitscreen multiplayer. In this couch co-op mode, Time Warp mechanics work a little differently. Rather than send the player back in time, placing a Time Warp Tetromino sends one of their opponents into the past. While in the past, any lines that the player completes will not be sent to their opponents, meaning they're strictly on the defensive until they return to the modern day.

Tetris Time Warp will not have online multiplayer or leaderboards at launch.

On the whole, Tetris Forever looks like it's shaping up to be a profound celebration of Tetris ' long history, and one certainly worth checking out for anyone even remotely interested in the evolution of video games as a medium.

Tetris Forever is set to launch on November 12 for Nintendo Switch, PC, PS4, PS5, Xbox One, and Xbox Series X/S.

item.title: Roblox: Peroxide Codes (October 2024)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Peroxide Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes in Peroxide
  • How to Get More Peroxide Codes
  • Peroxide Tips and Tricks
  • The Best Roblox Anime Games Like Peroxide

There are plenty of great Roblox games that are inspired by manga and anime, but few, if any, are quite as good as Peroxide . As its name suggests, it's based on Tite Kubo's Bleach and offers players an incredibly enjoyable combat experience that Ichigo himself would be proud of. As in most other Roblox games, that experience can become even better with the help of Peroxide codes.

Players can redeem Peroxide codes to claim a ridiculous amount of free Product Essences, which they can then take to Kisuke in The City to get rerolls on every individual path. Product Essences can also be used to acquire cosmetic items, which is why fans of the game are always on the lookout for all of the latest Peroxide codes.

Updated October 31, 2024, by Tom Bowen: The two newest Peroxide codes are HappyHalloween24 and ThanksRoblox , which players can redeem for a combined total of 60 free Product Essences. After claiming their rewards, fans of the game should take a moment to bookmark this page so that they can check back here every few days, as we're constantly on the lookout for new codes for Peroxide and will add any that we find to the list below.

How to Redeem Codes in Peroxide

As with similar Roblox games, the process of redeeming codes in Peroxide is relatively straightforward and does not require much knowledge or effort on the player's part. Even so, those having trouble can find step-by-step instructions on how to claim in-game rewards listed below:

  • First, it is necessary to launch Peroxide .
  • Then, if players are entering the game for the first time, they'll need to go through the tutorial.
  • Once the tutorial has been completed, in the upper left part of the screen, players should find and select the start button . It is located to the right of the chat button.
  • In the resulting menu, players should type or paste any of the active Peroxide codes listed above and then press Enter.

How to Get More Peroxide Codes

To get more Peroxide codes, players can subscribe to the developer's official Discord server, where they'll find news and updates about the game. However, the best solution is to bookmark this article, as it is updated every month.

Peroxide Tips and Tricks

Below, players will find some tips and tricks for Peroxide :

Shikai Unlocking

  • Reach level 15 as a Soul Reaper by completing quests on the board.
  • To defeat additional Hollows, visit Wake Up Mundo . It will cost 200 in-game currency.
  • Enhance stats by going to the gym near Kisuke or using agility boards.
  • After reaching level 15, meditate to unlock the Shikai.
  • Achieve B rank to use Shikai infinitely.

Resurrection Unlocking

  • Resurrection is automatically unlocked at level 15.

Use Crystals

  • Collect time relics to purchase crystals, which will enhance abilities.
  • Crystals can grant additional effects to attacks, such as setting enemies on fire.

Optimizing Stat Builds

  • Focus on combat stats rather than support stats.
  • Players need to choose stats based on their desired playstyle, whether it's a strength, vitality, or ability build.

The Best Roblox Anime Games Like Peroxide

Each game is special in its own way and offers an interesting gaming experience. That is why it is always fun for players to try something new. To that end, below is a list of the five best anime games like Peroxide :

  • Project Slayers
  • Anime Adventures
  • Blox Fruits
  • Titan Warfare
  • Type Soul

FAQ

Q: What is the newest code in Peroxide?

The newest Peroxide code is HappyHalloween24 , which players can redeem to get 30 free Product Essences.

item.title: Red Dead Redemption: Where To Find The Bandana
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Get Bandana in Red Dead Redemption
    • Reach Thieves' Landing
    • Buy the Bandana from the Tailor's Shop

Red Dead Redemption is a game about outlaws in the Wild West, so players need to look the part by rocking a Bandana while gunslinging. Whether you're shooting up a bar, or stealing some goods, you can't let anyone see John's face while he's breaking the law. So, simply equipping the Bandana will make sure his reputation stays positive in the West.

Bandana a cool little accessory that players can wear or remove to not only look like a true outlaw, and goes with every outfit you unlock in the game. However, the Bandana isn't just a cosmetic item, it also serves as a gameplay mechanic in Red Dead Redemption .

How to Get Bandana in Red Dead Redemption

Players will be able to purchase the Bandana for $20 from the tailor shop in Thieves' Landing in Red Dead Redemption . After completing a couple of starting missions in the game, the majority of the map will be unlocked for exploration.

The names of larger areas are automatically marked on the map. However, players must venture into these areas to uncover settlements, towns, and shops to uncover them on the map.

Reach Thieves' Landing

Thieves' Landing is located on the northeast side of MacFarlane's Ranch, where John wakes up at the start of the game. Once you're free to explore, venture to the location marked on the map above.

After reaching the location, players will spot the entrance of Thieves' Landing. It is a small community with activities to partake in, a bar where John can get himself tipsy, and some shops to purchase goods. Keep heading into the settlement, and cross a rope bridge over a stream.

Towards the end of the settlement, players will spot a Tailor's shop on the left, right below the Pharmacist in Thieves' Landing.

Buy the Bandana from the Tailor's Shop

Now all you have to do is head inside the shop and talk to the Tailor. After he shows you his wares, buy the Bandana, which costs $20. Now you can open up the inventory and find the Bandana under the "Kit" section of the satchel.

This is how players can get the Bandana early on in Red Dead Redemption . While John is wearing the Bandana, any position or negative actions won't have any impact on his fame, nor will it change his notoriety with the civilians. However, his crimes can still get reported, and a bounty can still be incurred, which has to be paid off.

Do remember to take the Bandana off before completing a mission, otherwise, John won't get any positive points in his fame meter.
